other_tests.findings: Normal posterior rhythm, diffuse intermittent slowing in the delta frequency range, but no periodic sharp waves.
Normal cell count, protein, and glucose; oligoclonal bands were not present and neuron-specific enolase was normal.
Generalized mild to moderate reduction of FDG uptake in both cerebral hemispheres, consistent with a nonspecific encephalopathy.
948 ng/mL, which is in the toxic range (normal <50; toxic >200 ng/mL).
other_tests.changes_over_time: At 10 weeks follow-up, whole blood bismuth level returned to normal at 9.5 ng/mL.

other_tests.findings: >406.5 ng/mL, which is in the toxic range (normal <50; toxic >200 ng/mL).
other_tests.changes_over_time: At 10 weeks follow-up, urine level declined to 8.6 ng/mL.
